content.description: Currently the leftmost bolted line on the wall. Climbs intimidatingly thin edges through a low bouldery crux then eases at the bulge and up through the roof to an anchor consisting of super shuts. The slight overhang makes this a tough but great route.
content.protection: 4 or 5 bolts and 2 shuts for anchor
content.location: Tan face left of a relatively clean crack.

content.description: Climb up on top of a block and climb a recessed column face.  If tall enough, you can stem up past the first two bolts before committing to the face.   Then  pass through the roof to the anchors.
content.location: Just left of where the approach trail connects to the wall. On a recessed face,  left of the center pillar, right of Childhood Injury.

content.description: Short but nice finger crack with lots of nice stemming options in a dihedral. The first few moves are the crux
content.location: Located in a right facing dihedral, right of Cave Walk and left and right of Mark's Window

content.description: Blocky climb up the arete. Fun Start to the first bolt, then follow the lichen covered arete to the anchor
content.location: Far right end of Mark's Wall, 80' right of the Frog

content.description: Pumpy moves, good holds, must have good footwork to stay on rock.  Sustained climbing.
content.location: Start on top of a huge boulder, Mark's Wall right

content.description:
Climb the face of the column right of the pillar where the approach trail connects to the wall. Use your balance and arete climbing skills to make your way from the first bolt to the third bolt then it is easier ground to the finish.

Shares an anchor with "Finger Crack" and "Cave Walk"
content.location:
First Route right of the pillar where the Approach trail connects to the wall.

Right of Age of Consent

content.description:
Fun face climb with good underclings and sidepulls.

Shares an anchor with "Where's My Cave"
content.location: Right end of Mark's Wall, 5' Left of "Where's the Cave?"

content.description:
Small crimps that get more positive as you go

For me the crux was figuring out when to move right or left, and how to clip without worrying about decking.

Bring a long stiff draw if you are short (5' 2")
content.location: right of Window of Wisdom dihedral and around the arête and left of Bloodstone

climbs.name: Frogs
climbs.fa: Andy Fitz, Ed Mosshart, Eric Sussman 1992

content.description:
A surprisingly pumpy arete, capped by a small roof.  For maximum value, start directly under the first bolt, boulder up on flat-edged crimps, and stay along the arete.  For weasel points, start to the right on a flake/rail and angle up and left to the arete.

The third bolt can be hard to clip if you don't have your balance right.  Try shifting your feet if it seems desperate.
content.location: On the right side of Mark's Wall, heading toward the Middle Wall.

content.description: Climb a left facing corner, Starts on top of the block, Flake and Crack leads to the top.
content.location: Just right of "Children of Lesser Chaos"  Left end of Mark's Wall

content.description: Follow a finger crack to a small roof, pulling it in the crack or out on the face to the right.
content.location: Just to right of approach trail in a right-facing corner formed by a pillar. Shares an anchor with Stone Embrace  (5.10c) and Cave Walk (5.10a).

content.description:
Technical stemming with positive finger locks lead you into a decomposing crack. Overcome it by face climbing and stemming and technique

Run it out a little bit to the anchors
content.location:
In the dihedral, left of Bloodstone and right of Tumbling Blocks

Watch out for wasps in the cracks!

content.description: Thin climbing along a left facing arete and thin, but positive crimps along the face lead to a bulge at the top. Crux is navigating the bulge with some long reaches
content.location: If memory serves me well, it is two bolt lines left of the obvious line Age of Consent

content.description: Second to Last Sport Route to the left.  Climb the arete with 4 bolts to chain anchors.
content.location: Second to last left most bolted route on Mark's wall

content.description: An opportunity to get well acquainted with the rare tieton sloper. Cruxy below the last bolt, and an exciting top out. Mislabeled in Yoder's guide as 10b.
content.location: The first bolted route about 10 feet left of Age of Consent. Clip the first bolt by standing the broken pillar top the the route's right.

content.description: Bouldery start followed by crimps into a roof. Find the hidden undercling jug to pull the roof and finish on more crimps to the anchor.
content.location: Just to the right of the approach trail in a right-facing corner formed by a pillar. Shares an anchor with Stone Embrace (5.10c) and Finger Crack (5.10a)

content.description:
Bruce is loose. He won't send your project, but he might blow up your spot. Nothing is sacred, and Washington, you've been warned!

Stem up the corner to an awkward pull over the roof, and on to the left side of the arete.
content.protection: 6 bolts to fixed clips on the anchor
content.location: Starts in the obvious, clean corner on top a chest high ledge

content.description: Slightly overhanging crimps and thin edges, tricky clips make this an enjoyable short climb
content.location: Around the arête right of Mark's Window and left of Corner Crack
